static gaia::base::String gaia::security::KeyStoreSecurity::getDefaultType ( ) [static]

Returns the default type for. 

 KeyStore

instances.

The default is specified in the 

 'keystore.type'

property in the file named 

 java.security

properties file. If this property is not set, 

 "jks"

will be used.

Returns:
the default type for 
 KeyStore
instances

void gaia::security::KeyStoreSecurity::load ( const gaia::base::String &  fileName,
const gaia::base::String &  pwd 
)

Initializes this. 

 KeyStore

from the provided 

 InputStream

. Pass 

 null

as the 

 stream

argument to initialize an empty 

 KeyStore

or to initialize a 

 KeyStore

which does not rely on an 

 InputStream

. This 

 KeyStore

utilizes the given password to verify the stored data.

Parameters:
fileNamethe fileName to load this 
 KeyStore
's data from or 
 null

passwordthe password to unlock the stored data, maybe 
 null

Associates the given alias with a certificate.

If the specified alias already exists, it will be reassigned.

Parameters:
aliasthe alias for the certificate.
certthe certificate.

PrivateKey *  key,
const char *  password,
gaia::base::Vector< X509Certificate * > *  chain 
)

Associates the given alias with the key, password and certificate chain.

If the specified alias already exists, it will be reassigned.

Parameters:
aliasthe alias for the key.
keythe key.
passwordthe password.
chainthe certificate chain.
void gaia::security::KeyStoreSecurity::setKeyEntry ( const gaia::base::String &  alias,
const byte_t *  key,
gaia::base::Vector< X509Certificate * > *  chain 
)

Associates the given alias with a key and a certificate chain.

If the specified alias already exists, it will be reassigned.

If this 

 KeyStore

is of type 

 "jks"

, 

 key

must be encoded conform to the PKS#8 standard as an javax.crypto.EncryptedPrivateKeyInfo.

Parameters:
aliasthe alias for the key.
keythe key in an encoded format.
chainthe certificate chain.

const gaia::base::String &  pwd

 KeyStore

to the specified 

 OutputStream

. The data written to the 

 OutputStream

is protected by the specified password.

passwordthe password to protect the data.
